Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2013 05:16PM canadianhockeymom wrote: Pathology is not back for 1 week.   It could be that I was so freaked out I misheard him say metastic.  I was only expecting one 7mm mass to be biopsied - but this doctor today had seen my previous mammograms and ultrasound forwarded from the other original doctor and had already marked down that there were 2 masses that needed core needle samples.  He also is fast tracking me to see a surgeon because he is 95% sure its _________ cancer. (maybe he said advanced/invasive?)   Catastrophic thinking has me at least a stage 3 or 4?
Posts.Title: Freaking out -Biopsy Question? canadianhockeymom Ariom

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2013 06:16PM canadianhockeymom wrote: I am trying to just breathe. My gp said to tell my kids NOW. My 19 & 17 year old boys are shell shocked. Tonight I have to tell 11 year old daughter. Its hard to breathe let alone speak
